details.title: COVID-19 HIGHLIGHTS | Tamil Nadu records 5,980 cases, tally in Chennai surpasses 1,294
details.content: After reporting more than 100 fatalities daily since August 3, the fresh death cases in the state was in double digits on Saturday. Active cases stood at 53,710 with 5,603 discharges from various health care facilities and in total 3,13,280 have recovered, a health department bulletin said. (READ FULL HIGHLIGHTS HERE)

details.title: India's COVID-19 caseload races past 30 lakh, total recoveries near 23 lakh
details.content: The Union health ministry on Saturday said the total number of recoveries has surged to 22,22,577 pushing the recovery rate to 74.69 per cent while the case fatality rate has further declined to 1.87 per cent. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Priority to distressed cases, mandatory COVID-19 tests: MHA issues SOP for foreign flights
details.content: Accordingly, persons desirous to travel to India on Vande Bharat flights, will register themselves with the Indian missions in the country where they are stranded or residing, along with necessary details as prescribed by Ministry of External Affairs. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: With nearly 70,000 new cases and 912 fatalities, India's COVID-19 tally crosses 30-lakh mark
details.content: With a single-day spike of 69,239 infections, the country's COVID-19 caseload mounted to 30,44,940, while the death toll climbed to 56,706 with 912 fatalities being reported in a span of 24-hours, the data updated at 8 am showed. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Close to 2400 new cases in Telangana as states increases testing
details.content:
#Telangana recorded a spike in Covid-19 cases on Saturday, mainly due to increase in cases in districts.

The state recorded 2,384 positive cases, as it conducted 40,666 tests in a single day.

This increases total number of Covid-19 cases in the state till now to 1,04, 249. pic.twitter.com/cVGkAtRlQO

— TNIE Telangana (@XpressHyderabad) August 23, 2020

details.title: New SOP for Film, TV shootings
details.content: The shooting of films and TV serials can be resumed now while following the norms of social distancing and wearing of masks except for the people who are being recorded on camera: Prakash Javadekar, Union Minister for Information and Broadcasting.

Today @MIB_India have released a detailed SOP for resuming work in the media production industry. The general principles behind the SOP will help create a safe working environment for cast and crew in the industry. pic.twitter.com/UU0NbqONeO

— Prakash Javadekar (@PrakashJavdekar) August 23, 2020

details.title: COVID-19: Centre releases SOPs for resumption of shooting of films, TV serials in 'new normal'
details.content: Information and Broadcasting Minister Prakash Javadekar hoped that the release of the SOPs will not only lead to resumption of shooting of films and TV serials, but also generate employment. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Three COVID-19 patients untraceable in UP's Muzaffarnagar
details.content: Three people who tested COVID-19 positive in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar district cannot be traced as they provided fake information and phone numbers during sample collection, officials said on Sunday. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Serum Institute of India clarifes on claims over COVISHIELD availability
details.content:
Serum Institute of India clarifies that the current claims over COVISHIELD's availability, in the media are completely false and conjectural. details.title: 'Aspirants under tremendous pressure': Congress MP writes to PM for deferment of JEE, NEET exams
details.content:
Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury, Leader of Congress in Lok Sabha, writes to PM Modi for deferment of JEE & NEET exams till COVID-19 situation stabilises. "Aspirants are under tremendous mental pressure as to how they could be remained immune while attending exams physically," he writes. pic.twitter.com/dgMpXRiUPO

— ANI (@ANI) August 23, 2020

details.title: COVID-19 effect: Homeopathic drug given to half of Gujarat population since March
details.content: In its presentation made before the World Health Organisation on August 20 on Gujarat's COVID-19 prevention strategy, the health department said it distributed Arsenicum Album-30 to 3.48 crore people, which is more than half of the state's population of 6.6 crore. (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: COVID-19 effect: RTI finds 1.78 crore rail tickets cancelled in five months
details.content: Last year, while the Railways had refunded Rs 3,660.08 crore for the April 1-August 11 period, it also earned Rs 17,309.1 crore in the same period. This is the first time when the refunds were more than the amount earned by the Railways from sale of tickets. (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: India's Covid patients recovery rate nearly 75%
details.content:
India’s total recoveries now exceed the total active cases (7,07,668) by nearly 16 lakhs (1,572,898):

A consistently increasing number of recoveries has pushed India's Recovery Rate amongst the #COVID19 patients to nearly 75%. With the recoveries of 57,989 COVID patients in the last 24 hours, the total number of recoveries has reached 22,80,566 today: Ministry fo Health pic.twitter.com/T4lvzO2J3a

— ANI (@ANI) August 23, 2020

details.title: COVID-19 led to revival of technology, expertise, says Infosys co-founder Nandan Nilekani
details.content: Nilekani said that during the ongoing crisis, digital and medical technologies stood out, which enabled people to work from home, among other things, and helped in dealing with the virus by developing better tests, drugs, and vaccines. (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Chorus grows for postponing entrance exams amid pandemic
details.content: Students from across the country have demanded that CBSE compartment exams be cancelled and entrance exams such as UGC-NET, CLAT, NEET and JEE be postponed in the wake of rising COVID-19 cases. (READ MORE)

details.title: Soren directs action after criminal seen celebrating with liquor inside COVID-19 ward
details.content: A COVID-19 Hospital in Dhanbad has hit the headlines once again on Sunday after photographs of a small time criminal celebrating and taking liquor inside the ward with handcuffs on his hands went viral on social media on Sunday. (READ MORE)

details.title: Brain fog, lung fibrosis problems haunt patients post recovery
details.content: Even as more than 80 percent of people infected by Covid-19 in Tamil Nadu have been discharged, not everyone has fully ‘recovered’. Several patients continue to suffer from brain fog, giddiness and ever serious complications like lung fibrosis and vascular problems. (READ MORE)

details.title: Goa registers 209 fresh cases
details.content:

— ANI (@ANI) August 23, 2020

details.title: Ganesh idols immersed without processions in Goa
details.content: Many Goans on Sunday bid adieu to Lord Ganesh, as many households follow the tradition of immersing the idols one-and-a-half-day after Ganesh Chaturthi, which marks the beginning of the annual 10-day festival. (READ MORE)

details.title: West Bengal registers 3274 cases of virus infection
details.content: West Bengal on Sunday recorded 3,274 new COVID-19 cases, taking the total number of cases to 1,38,870 including 28,069 active cases and 2,794 deaths. The state now has 1,08,007 recoveries, the state health department said.

details.title: Bengal Environment Minister tests COVID-19 positive
details.content: West Bengal Environment Minister Soumen Mahapatra on Sunday said he has tested positive for COVID-19. Stating that he is asymptomatic, the minister urged people who had come in contact with him recently to be in home isolation. (READ MORE)

details.title: Pigs roam in Raichur COVID hospital, complaint filed against owner
details.content: Days after pigs were seen roaming in a hospital in Karburgi, another incident of pigs roaming around in Raichur district hospital has come to light. (READ MORE)

details.title: Global update | 'China approves emergency usage of COVID-19 vaccines'
details.content: China has authorised emergency usage of COVID-19 vaccines developed by some select domestic companies, a Chinese health official has said. An emergency use authorisation, which is based on Chinese vaccine management law, allows unapproved vaccine candidates to be used among people who are at high risk of getting infected on a limited period. (READ MORE)

details.title: After Sprinklr controversy, C-DIT unveils Koode for data management
details.content: Nearly three months after the government dumped American company 'Sprinklr' over the data breach controversy, the state-owned Centre for Development of Imaging Technology (C-DIT) has come up with its own application called 'Koode' to collate the details of people under observation for Covid-19 on a daily basis. (READ MORE)

details.title: Chennai model would help control COVID in Coimbatore: Tamil Nadu Health Minister C Vijayabaskar
details.content: Claiming that the Chennai model would help control the spread of Covid-19 in Coimbatore, Health Minister C Vijayabaskar on Sunday said that the district administration would go for aggressive testing strategy. (READ MORE)

details.title: Game on COVID
details.content:
My uncle had suggested me to develop a game on COVID. So I became interested. Development of the game completed last week & it was launched day before yesterday. It's new to me, so I browsed through YouTube & read articles for 3-4 weeks to fully understand it: Baldeep Ningthoujam https://t.co/wcIjMpbT4y pic.twitter.com/fK0euYk0Pc

— ANI (@ANI) August 23, 2020

details.title: Avoiding test result errors is health department’s priority over finding new ways of testing
details.content: Using throat-wash sample and saliva to detect the novel coronavirus are among the innovative solutions scientists are working on globally to speed up testing. (READ MORE)

details.title: Special strategy to keep in check intra-hospital transmission of COVID-19 in Kerala
details.content: The department will investigate cases in which healthcare workers and patients get infected on a case-to-case basis. (READ MORE)

details.title: COVID-19 outbreak: Two die, 50 kids among infected
details.content: Among the fresh cases, 309 persons contracted the disease through local transmission with the sources of infection of 56 persons remaining unknown. (READ MORE)

details.title: Kerala private bus operators plan to slam the brakes
details.content: According to bus owners, even the institutional lenders were not keen to seize the buses for causing loan arrears. (READ MORE)

details.title: Kerala government lifts ban on property registration at homes
details.content: The ban, introduced as a COVID-19 precautionary measure in April, hit senior citizens who needed to transact their properties. (READ MORE)

details.title: Kalamassery sees spike, no containment zone yet
details.content: According to the officials, most of the fresh cases were reported at a South Korean conglomerate’s warehouse near the HMT Junction. (READ MORE)

details.title: New hurdle: Hospitals in Karnataka run short of oxygen support
details.content: Karnataka Medical Education Minister Sudhakar K has said the government will make arrangements to supply liquid oxygen to all hospitals in the state. (READ MORE)

details.title: Karnataka’s COVID curve improves, recovery rate reaches 68 per cent
details.content: While the recovery rate has shot up to 68.23 per cent, the mortality rate has dipped to 1.68 per cent, according to the state war room. (READ MORE)

details.title: Chaos in Karnataka's Kundapur after body mix-up by hospital, DC seeks report
details.content: Family members and locals staged a flash protest against the district administration and demanded that the DC arrive at the spot. (READ MORE)
